page.title: 04Palmers Brush Factory
page.content: The factory, built in 1869, is owned by the Palmer family and{employs}about {100 people.}A variety of brushes are made and exported, ranging from{deck {brooms}for ships to{nail brushes.} Materials come from all over the world :bristle from China, coconut fibres from India, wooden broom handles from Brazil. Most of the synthetic fibres are made in Britain. On average,{12 thousand brushes}are made daily, the finished articles being painted red, beige or brown. The cost of a sweeping brush is Â£2.00. Each mould costs Â£5000-Â£6000.The shavings from the wood are burnt to keep the factory warm in the winter. The average machine worker is paid about{Â£100 per week.}Working hours are from{7.30am to 4.30pm. -Sarah Craddock Penhale Middle School
